thread.title: SAGCO 1, National Guard, Electro and FMG win at SAGCO Cup
thread.title_full: SAGCO 1, National Guard, Electro and FMG win at SAGCO Cup | Sports | Saudi Gazette

author: saudigazette.com.sa
title: SAGCO 1, National Guard, Electro and FMG win at SAGCO Cup
text:
Chief guest Christine Granada-Buhay addressing the audience as SAGCO basketball committee members look on.
KMA Perera
JEDDAH — The fourth Saudi Arabian Glass Co. Basketball Tournament got off to a flying start at the SAGCO basketball court in the Sinaiya Industrial Area here last Friday.
The opening ceremony was preceded by a colorful parade by 24 teams vying for the prestigious SAGCO Cup. The tournament was declared open by SAGCO Plant Manager Nico De Wet. The chief guest was Christine Granada-Buhay, cultural officer of the Philippine Consulate General. Among other invitees were David Ouellette, Tilon Reddy, S. Srinivasan and Venkaiah Nelluri of SAGCO management.
Addressing the event Christine said that the tournament has earned accolade in Jeddah and thanked SAGCO for conducting a social responsibility event with an emphasis on sportsmanship and community camaraderie. She selected the team for the best uniform award, which went to Attieh Steel Company. Mrs. De Wet selected the best muse and Al-Tayyar team won the prize.
The first two games were played by the tournament favorites SAGCO 1 and last year’s champion National Guard team against Medina Transporter and NAPICO, respectively. Both secured emphatic victories. SAGCO 1 won at 102-60, while National Guard proved its superiority with a 122-69 win. Rudy Opena of SAGCO 1 and J. Tacumba of National Guard were adjudged best players.
Newcomers Electro and FMG prevailed in second day’s two games. The highest scorer of all games during the weekend was Maputol of Al-Jazeera, who scored 36 points.
Scores:
SAGCO 1 102 — Rudy Opena 22, Carlo Morada 21, Oliver Morado 14. Medina Transporter 60 — John Leal 19, Chris Gonzales 13.
National Guard 122 — J. Tacumba 24, D. Daanco 18, G. Binas 18. NAPICO 69 — J. Canienzo 28, Baysauli 14.
Electro 91 — Cuadra 28, M. Bustos 18. Al-Jazeera 87 — Maputol 36, J. Diola 18.
FMG 100 — Jomar An 13, Arquimedes Ela 10. SAGCOB 40 — Mario De Luna 12, Alan Tiangco 10.
